page.title: 07EDUCATION
page.content: The block has establishments that cater for a range from Primary schools to Adult Colleges and Special schools that provide for handicapped children Many Primary schools are housed in older buildings some dated about 1860. Secondary school buildings have been built more recently, in the period from 1928.The average numbers of children in Primary schools are between 200 and 300 and Secondary schools vary from St.Mary's R.C.'s 316 to Heath Park's 1450. Secondary education is changing.Some provide for children from 11 to 16 but some still have a 6th.Form.All will soon cater for 11 to 16 only and a Tertiary college system will be developed. Most schools are state funded but some are still financed and controlled by various churches. Bilston Community College has 8,500 students and 200 staff.
